instructions:
Tie peppercorns, allspice and bay leaf in a cheesecloth bag. In a 6-quart pot, add water, chicken broth,
ham hocks, crushed garlic and spice bag. Simmer for 1 1/2 hours. Remove ham hocks and take meat off
bones. Return bones to broth, add dry peas and simmer for 45 minutes. At this point remove and discard
bones and garnish bag.
Medium grind meat from bones and add to the broth along with carrots, celery and onions. Simmer for
another 45 minutes. Makes 6 pints. 
*(Rev. 6/2/97)*
ingredients: 1 pkg (16 oz) dry split peas, picked over and rinsed
name: Split Pea Soup
creator: Mary Decker
